senses.de: To look at something or somebody with pleasure

Tips.title: Positive Emotion
Tips.description: Shows you have positive feelings about someone's actions or qualities.
Tips.example: Watching the kids play, I admired their simple joy.

Tips.title: Visual Pleasure
Tips.description: Used when something is visually pleasing and you appreciate looking at it.
Tips.example: We admired the colorful sunset from the balcony.

Tips.title: No Envy
Tips.description: Admiring doesn't mean you're jealous, it's a form of respect.
Tips.example: I admire her style, but I'm content with my own.

senses.de: To respect or think highly of someone or something
senses.ex: Everyone admires her for her honesty.

Tips.title: Genuine Esteem
Tips.description: Implies sincerity when you have a high opinion of someone's attributes.
Tips.example: She admired her teacher's patience with all her students.

Tips.title: Acknowledging Skills
Tips.description: To recognize and respect a person's skills or achievements.
Tips.example: He admired her ability to resolve conflicts with ease.

Tips.title: Vocal Praise
Tips.description: You often express your admiration of someone aloud to others.
Tips.example: The community openly admired the mayor's dedication.

senses.ex: She stood back to admire her handwork.

Tips.title: Personal Achievement
Tips.description: When you admire something you've done yourself, it shows pride in your work.
Tips.example: After redecorating, I took a moment to admire my handiwork.

Tips.title: Emotional Response
Tips.description: It's a feeling that combines respect and pleasure.
Tips.example: I admire your dedication to volunteering; it warms my heart.

Adore.wordDefinition:
Adore is used when we have a strong feeling of love and admiration towards someone or something. For example, you might adore your partner for their kindness and thoughtfulness.

Admire is used to express appreciation, while adore is for expressing a strong feeling of love and admiration.

Applaud.wordDefinition:
Applaud means to show approval or praise by clapping hands. It is applicable when we want to express our appreciation for someone's performance, speech, or achievement.

For example, we may applaud a musician's concert, a politician's speech, or an athlete's victory.

Appreciate.wordDefinition:
Appreciate means recognizing the value or worth of something or someone. It involves the idea of being grateful for or enjoying something.

We use the word appreciate when we want to express how much we like or understand something.

Admire is used when we want to express respect for someone or something they have achieved, while appreciate is used when we want to express gratitude or enjoyment for something or someone that we like.

Esteem.wordDefinition:
Esteem means to hold someone in high regard and respect for their inner qualities, like their principles or character.

Esteem goes beyond the external display of actions or talent and focuses on the inner qualities of a person. For example, a person may esteem their friend for their loyalty and honesty.

However, admire is more commonly used to describe admiration of someone's external qualities, while esteem is more commonly used to describe the admiration of someone's inner qualities.

Glorify.wordDefinition:
Glorify means to praise or honor someone or something.

Example: Some people glorify celebrities for their fame and fortune.

In simpler terms, admire is about respect and fondness, while glorify is about praise and honor.

Admire can be applied in everyday life when we appreciate a person or thing, whereas glorify is usually used in a more formal or religious context to elevate someone or something to a higher status.

Honour.wordDefinition:
Honour is used when we show respect and recognition to someone for their achievements, contributions, or special qualities.

For example, we can honour a war veteran for their bravery and sacrifice for their country.

Admire is used when we feel positive emotions towards someone, while honour is used when we want to show respect to someone for their accomplishments or qualities.

Idolize.wordDefinition:
Idolize means to have an excessive or unhealthy admiration or worship for someone or something. It is when you elevate someone to a level where they can do no wrong, even if they have flaws or make mistakes.

For example, if someone idolizes a celebrity, they may ignore any negative behavior or actions of that celebrity.

In general, it is good to admire people for positive traits and actions, but idolizing someone too much can be unhealthy and potentially problematic.

Respect.wordDefinition:
Respect means to have a feeling of deep admiration or esteem towards someone or something based on their achievements, actions, or qualities.

It can also mean to behave in a polite and courteous way towards others. For instance: "I respect what he has accomplished in his life.".

It is sometimes used as a synonym for "like." Respect is used more to describe how we hold people or things in high esteem based on their deeds, achievements, or position in society.

quotes.Text: When I look at acting careers that I really admire, I see that it's been a precise decision-making process for these people. They make decisions based on what they love, and they do only the things that they are passionate about. They play only characters that they can't stop thinking about.
quotes.Title: American Singer
quotes.Name: Taylor Swift

quotes.Text: I think it is perfectly natural for any artist to admire intensely and love a young man. It is an incident in the life of almost every artist.
quotes.Title: Irish Poet
quotes.Name: Oscar Wilde

quotes.Text: We always love those who admire us, but we do not always love those whom we admire.
quotes.Title: French Writer
quotes.Name: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

quotes.Text: Ayrton Senna was an incredible legend who will be remembered and admired forever.
quotes.Title: British Driver
quotes.Name: Lewis Hamilton

quotes.Text: Tell me who admires and loves you, and I will tell you who you are.
quotes.Title: French Writer
quotes.Name: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quotes.Text: The successful men I admired all built their bodies.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Dwayne Johnson

quotes.Text: You always admire what you really don't understand.
quotes.Title: French Philosopher
quotes.Name: Blaise Pascal

quotes.Text: Few men have been admired of their familiars.
quotes.Title: French Philosopher
quotes.Name: Michel de Montaigne

quotes.Text: He who goes unenvied shall not be admired.
quotes.Title: Greek Poet
quotes.Name: Aeschylus

quotes.Text: I respect and admire what cops do.
quotes.Title: American Baseball Player
quotes.Name: Charles Barkley
